title: Why do employers ask for a high school diploma in application when they don't actually care about it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most of the time it’s just corporate policy and a way to screen candidates (discourage those without diplomas, so they don’t bother applying). Even if the manager doesn’t care, HR tends to be concerned with who is being hired. If the job has specific qualifications, like a diploma, that was determined to be the requirement after money was spent and companies don’t like to waste money. In other businesses, specifically smaller businesses, they tend to follow those requirements as well. They do so, because it typically means better candidates in general. These candidates are more likely to follow basic directions and communicate at a higher level than someone without a diploma (though that’s definitely not always the case).
